  • Business analysis principles

Business analysis principles

  1. Root cause not symptoms
  2. Business Improvement not IT change
  3. Options not solutions
  4. Smart requirements that deliver to a consensus (feasible, contributing)
  5. Focus on the entire business change lifecycle, not just requirements definition
  6. Negotiation not avoidance
  7. Strategy implementation

1. Root cause not symptoms

Focus on Root cause of the problem.

2. Business Improvement not IT change

IT systems should enable business opportunity or problem resolution.

3. Options not solutions

Present evaluated options. Always consider and evaluate all options available, instead of choosing the first solution available.

4. Smart requirements that deliver to a consensus (feasible, contributing)

Requirements are NOT a wishlist, they have to be fully evaualted (financial and Time Contdratints) to meet the business need.

5. Focus on the entire business change lifecycle, not just requirements definition

Benefits realisation.

6. Negotiation not avoidance

Resolve the conflicts.

7. Strategy implementation

All requirements are aligned and prioritised in accordance with the corporate vision.
